disallowedHeaders.description: Report message when the response includes multiple disallowed headers
disallowedHeaders.message: Response should not include disallowed headers: $1

headerValueShouldOnlyContain.description: Report message when the 'server' header contains more than the server name
headerValueShouldOnlyContain.message: The 'server' header should only contain the server name.

disallowedExpiresHeader.description: Report message when the response includes the Expires header
disallowedExpiresHeader.message: The 'Expires' header should not be used, 'Cache-Control' should be preferred.

disallowedHostHeader.description: Report message when the response includes the Host header
disallowedHostHeader.message: The 'Host' header should not be used, it is a request header only.

disallowedP3PHeader.description: Report message when the response includes the P3P header
disallowedP3PHeader.message: The 'P3P' header should not be used, it is a non-standard header only implemented in Internet Explorer.

disallowedPragmaHeader.description: Report message when the response includes the Pragma header
disallowedPragmaHeader.message: The 'Pragma' header should not be used, it is deprecated and is a request header only.

disallowedXFrameOptionsHeader.description: Report message when the response includes the X-Frame-Options header
disallowedXFrameOptionsHeader.message: The 'X-Frame-Options' header should not be used. A similar effect, with more consistent support and stronger checks, can be achieved with the 'Content-Security-Policy' header and 'frame-ancestors' directive.
